title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2.10 - Notification by employer of termination of licensee's employment and return of evidence of license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2.10 - Notification by employer of termination of licensee's employment and return of evidence of license

State Regulations

Upon the termination of the employment of a licensee, without
any understanding or arrangement for reemployment, or in the event of the
failure of the applicant (employer) to employ the licensee within 30 days after
issuance of the license, the applicant (employer) shall forthwith notify the
commission of such termination of employment or failure to employ and return to
the commission any license, badge or other evidence of issuance of a license in
its possession. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
2.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
